intro: Steptorhamphus soongoricus, commonly known as the Soongorica thistle, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
